verse: कस्तूरीतिलकं ललाटपटले वक्षःस्थले कौस्तुभम् नासाग्रे वरमौक्तिकं करतले वेणुः करे कंकणम् । सर्वांगे हरिचन्दनं सुललितं कण्ठे च मुक्तावली गोपस्त्री परिवेष्टितो विजयते गोपालचूड़ामणिः ॥
overall_meaning: Adorned with a musk mark on his broad forehead, the Kaustubha gem on his chest, an excellent pearl at the tip of his nose, a flute in his palm, and bangles on his hand, and with his entire body anointed with fragrant sandalwood paste, and wearing a beautiful garland of pearls around his neck, the crown jewel among cowherds, Krishna, surrounded by the cowherd women, is victorious.
